Image titled Display Nicknames for Contacts on an iPhone Step 5 1 Open the Contacts app. The icon looks like a grey silhouette of a man and is located on one of the home screens. Image titled Display Nicknames for Contacts on an iPhone Step 6 2 Tap on a contact to edit. All of your contacts will be listed on the left side of the screen. Image titled Display Nicknames for Contacts on an iPhone Step 7 3 Tap . This button is in the upper right corner of the screen. Image titled Display Nicknames for Contacts on an iPhone Step 8 4 Scroll down and tap . This button is right above the Linked Contacts section. Image titled Display Nicknames for Contacts on an iPhone Step 9 5 Scroll down and tap . It is located at the bottom of the first group of options in the popup menu. The popup menu will disappear. Image titled Display Nicknames for Contacts on an iPhone Step 10 6 Scroll up and tap on the Nickname field. It is near the top of the contact profile, underneath the contact s first and last name. Image titled Display Nicknames for Contacts on an iPhone Step 11 7 Input a nickname. Image titled Display Nicknames for Contacts on an iPhone Step 12 8 Tap . This is in the upper right corner of the screen. The nickname will now replace the contact s actual name and will appear anytime the contact is displayed during a phone call, text message, or email.
